project.name: C-C126B-SUBV-01-ST03-DT01-DF15-CF18-01
project.description: Creating test case using base program. Added a Socket Server to accept communication from untrusted source. Completed injection.

output_checks.simple_check: if (( $(wc -c "../logfile.txt" | cut -d " " -f 1) > 126 )); then true; else false; fi;

iopair.name: C-C126B-SUBV-01-ST03-DT01-DF15-CF18-01-BAD-02
iopair.description: Has a fixed heap buffer of size 64. (malloc(64*sizeof(char))) When input has a larger size, the heap buffer will be over read

process.script: cd ../good-02 && cp file.txt stonesoup && cd stonesoup && $SS_TC_DEPS/bin/svn add file.txt

/opt/stonesoup/workspace/scripts/service_mon.sh ss-localhost 8887 && curl -v --data-urlencode data="This is probably going to overflow a buffer of some sort. Let's run it anyway and see what happens. I hope that everything turns out ok, because I would love to see what this looks like in all CAPS. Converting ASCII characters to upper case is easy, you can either call a system function, or just add the standard difference between the start of the two character sets. But, I am sure there is a reason that system functions exist for this sort of functionality." --header "If-Match: weak_taint_source_value" --request POST --no-buffer --output /opt/stonesoup/workspace/testData/logfile.txt --silent --show-error http://ss-localhost:8887
